head.supplied: ¶ [A Letter was read, received from Dr Mueller, in which complaints were made of damage done to the Pines by the cows and of the dilapidated condition of the Fences around the Swamp at the rear of th...

div.p: Executive Committee minute book, Immigrants Aid Society records, Mount Royal Hospital, Melbourne.

Transcribed 30.6.93. To proof.
Letter not found; item is an extract from the minutes of a meeting of the Executive Committee held on 23 May 1867.
[A Letter was read, received from Dr Mueller, in which complaints were made of damage done to the Pines by the cows and of the dilapidated condition of the Fences around the Swamp at the rear of the Home.]
The Superintendent of the Immigrants Aid Society Home, James Greig, informed the Executive Committee 'that the cows of the Home were watched by an Inmate during the day, and at night were penned up in the Shed, but owing to the carelessness of the men employed by the Land & Works dep. in removing soil from the swamp, the slip panels were left open, and stray cattle, in numbers, were in consequence to be found roaming about the Reserve night and day'. The Committee moved that a reply conveying the above statement be sent to M.
See also R. Kerr to M, May 1867 In this edition as 67-05-00d).
